title: Paleocene
summary: The Paleocene, ( /ˈpæl.i.əˌsiːn, -i.oʊ-, ˈpeɪ.li-, -li.oʊ-/ PAL-ee-ə-seen, -⁠ee-oh-, PAY-lee-, -⁠lee-oh-)[4] or Palaeocene, is a geological epoch that lasted from about 66 to 56 million years ago (mya). It is the first epoch of the Paleogene Period in the modern Cenozoic Era. The name is a combination of the Ancient Greek παλαιός palaiós meaning "old" and the Eocene Epoch (which succeeds the Paleocene), translating to "the old part of the Eocene".
